characters.name: Angus McSteer
characters.description: A member of a cattle-rustling gang who terrorizes Applejack and Rarity in Friends Forever Issue #8. Also appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #25 and Friendship is Magic Issue #26.

characters.name: Bessie
characters.description: A female cow who appears in Applebuck Season, in Sleepless in Ponyville, in Three's A Crowd, in Pinkie Pride, in Slice of Life, in MLPEG Friendship Games _Bloopers_, in Hard to Say Anything, and in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You. She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game Absolute Discord expansion set card #18 U that attributes to Lemony Gem and Mint Jewelup the respective quotes "Is that a cow bathing in a lake of milk?" and "Yes, it seems to be... Wait, what were we doing again?" Her name was previously used for a G1 dairymaid and was a conceptual name for DaisyJo.

characters.name: Big Angie
characters.description: One of the judges of the cooking competition in Friends Forever Issue #1. Named partly the same as Angie.

characters.name: Buffalo Bull
characters.description: A member of a cattle-rustling gang who terrorizes Applejack and Rarity in Friends Forever Issue #8. Also appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #25 and Friendship is Magic Issue #26. Shares his name with an Earth pony stallion.

characters.name: Buffy
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #51 as a patron of a saloon where Applejack and Fluttershy ask for information about Shadow Lock. Named like Miss Buffy.

characters.name: Prince Crompus
characters.description: Mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #62 as a former prince of Yakyakistan.

characters.name: DaisyJo
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Doc Holstein
characters.description: A member of a cattle-rustling gang who terrorizes Applejack and Rarity in Friends Forever Issue #8. Also appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #25 and Friendship is Magic Issue #26.

characters.name: Prince Dromius
characters.description: Mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #62 as a former prince of Yakyakistan.

characters.name: Grimhorn
characters.description: Mentioned by Prince Rutherford in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever.

characters.name: Prince Gruntwig
characters.description: Mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #62 as a former prince of Yakyakistan and one of the cosigners of an ancient treaty between Equestria and Griffonstone.

characters.name: Horwitz
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #61 and Issue #62 as the official yak archivist at the Convocation of Creatures. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Convocation of the Creatures!" event. His bio states, "One of Yakyakistan's foremost historians, Horwitz always carries himself with dignity -- and a pitch-perfect Oxenford accent."

characters.name: Ingville
characters.description: Mentioned by Prince Rutherford in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever.

characters.name: Jersey Shore
characters.description: A member of a cattle-rustling gang who terrorizes Applejack and Rarity in Friends Forever Issue #8. Also appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #25 and Friendship is Magic Issue #26.

characters.name: Leroy
characters.description: One of Prince Rutherford's aides mentioned in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #26.

characters.name: Little Strongheart
characters.description: Little Strongheart is a young female buffalo who first appears in Over a Barrel. Her name is in the style of a traditional Native American name, and her feathered headband is also part of the Native American motif shared among the buffalo herd.

characters.name: King Longhorn
characters.description: King Longhorn is a male bull and leader of the Cattle Rustlers gang. He appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #8 as a minor antagonist and in the two-issue story arc The Good, the Bad and the Ponies as the main antagonist.

characters.name: Moo-riella
characters.description: A female cow who appears in Applebuck Season. Her being frightened by a snake causes a herd of cows to stampede.

characters.name: Prince Rutherford
characters.description: Prince Rutherford is a male yak and the prince of the kingdom of Yakyakistan. He first appears in the season five episode Party Pooped.

characters.name: Chief Thunderhooves
characters.description: Chief Thunderhooves is the chief of a tribe of buffalo who first appears in the episode Over a Barrel. He leads the buffalo tribe against the settlers of Appleloosa, due to their apple orchards blocking his tribe's traditional stampeding grounds.

characters.name: Tormand
characters.description: Mentioned by Prince Rutherford in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever.

characters.name: Prince Ulysses
characters.description: A yak prince mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #56 as having made peace with the dragons, bestowed the title of "honorary yak" upon Dragon Lord Scintilla, and founded Yakyakistan.

characters.name: Yakatar
characters.description: One of Prince Rutherford's aides mentioned in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #26.

characters.name: Yakmina
characters.description: A Yakyakistan spa owner in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #26. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the "Convocation of the Creatures!" event. Her bio states, "Owner-operator of Yakyakistan's premier spa service. Be sure to try their mineral baths!"

characters.name: Yigrid
characters.description: A yovidaphone-playing yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Yakity-Sax. Voiced by Patricia Drake.

characters.name: Yksler
characters.description: An ancient yak warrior whose helmet was donated to the School of Friendship and serves as a centerpiece in a scavenger hunt in A Matter of Principals.

characters.name: Yojan
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever and the Best Gift Ever storybook A Perfectly Pinkie Present! as a resident of Yakyakistan.

characters.name: Yona
characters.description: Yona, or Yona Yak, is a female yak and one of the Young Six[1][2][3] who first appears in season eight of the show as a student at Twilight Sparkle's School of Friendship. In the series finale The Last Problem, she is an employee at Rarity's Carousel Boutique years in the future.

characters.name: S05E11 Unnamed Yak #1
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Party Pooped, Not Asking for Trouble, School Daze - Part 2, and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever.

characters.name: S05E11 Unnamed Yak #2
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Party Pooped, Not Asking for Trouble, and School Daze - Part 2.

characters.name: S05E11 Unnamed Yak #3
characters.description: A young yak calfâ€”Yona's sisterâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Party Pooped and The Hearth's Warming Club. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Unscripted in Party Pooped; come up with and referred to as male by Sabrina Alberghetti.

characters.name: S07E11 Unnamed Yak #1
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, Yakity-Sax, and The Ending of the End - Part 2. Voiced (uncredited).

characters.name:
Tenacious Yak
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #2
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, School Daze - Part 2, The Maud Couple, Yakity-Sax, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem and is a character called "Tenacious Yak" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "She listens to tales by the bright fireside -- a lover of stories, and filled with yak pride!" Shares her design with S08E15 Unnamed Yak #1.

characters.name:
Yona's Mom
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #3
characters.description: A yakâ€”Yona's motherâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, The Maud Couple, The Hearth's Warming Club, Yakity-Sax, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem. Voiced by Kathleen Barr in A Horse Shoe-In.

characters.name:
Fluffy Yak Calf
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #4
characters.description: A young yak calfâ€”Yona's brotherâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, The Hearth's Warming Club, and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever and is a character called "Fluffy Yak Calf" in Gameloft's mobile game. Shares his design with S09E26 Unnamed Yak #3. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: S07E11 Unnamed Yak #5
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, The Maud Couple, Yakity-Sax, and The Last Problem.

characters.name:
Yona's Dad
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #6
characters.description: A yakâ€”Yona's fatherâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, The Hearth's Warming Club, Yakity-Sax, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, Uprooted, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem, and is a character called "Decorated Yak" in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "This well-adorned yak is a sight to behold! His lovely dÃ©cor keeps him safe from the cold." Shares his design with S09E26 Unnamed Yak #2. Voiced by Peter New in A Horse Shoe-In.

characters.name: S07E11 Unnamed Yak #7
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, Yakity-Sax, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, and The Ending of the End - Part 2. Shares his design with S08E15 Unnamed Yak #2 and S09E26 Unnamed Yak #1.

characters.name:
Mighty Yak
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #8
characters.description: A yak from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble, Yakity-Sax, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem and is a character called "Mighty Yak" in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name:
Bright-Eyed Yak Calf
S07E11 Unnamed Yak #9
characters.description: A young yak calf from Yakyakistan who appears in Not Asking for Trouble and in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever and is a character called "Bright-Eyed Yak Calf" in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Kelly Sheridan.

characters.name:
Yona's Grandma
S08E15 Unnamed Yak #1
characters.description: A yakâ€”Yona's grandmotherâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Yona's story in The Hearth's Warming Club and in The Ending of the End - Part 2. She is a character called "Yona's Grandma" in Gameloft's mobile game. Shares her design with S07E11 Unnamed Yak #2. Her bio states, "She can still remember the Snilldar Fest when her hair was braided for the first time - a tradition she's eager to pass on!"

characters.name:
Yona's Grandpa
S08E15 Unnamed Yak #2
characters.description: A yakâ€”Yona's grandfatherâ€”from Yakyakistan who appears in Yona's story in The Hearth's Warming Club and in The Ending of the End - Part 2. He is a character called "Yona's Grandpa" in Gameloft's mobile game. His bio states, "This elder knows all the best Snilldar Fest songs... Well, he knows at least ONE Snilldar Fest song, anyway." Shares his design with S07E11 Unnamed Yak #7 and S09E26 Unnamed Yak #1.

characters.name: S09E26 Unnamed Yak #1
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem in future Canterlot. Shares his design with S07E11 Unnamed Yak #7 and S08E15 Unnamed Yak #2.

characters.name: S09E26 Unnamed Yak #2
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem in future Canterlot. Shares his design with S07E11 Unnamed Yak #6.

characters.name: S09E26 Unnamed Yak #3
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem in future Canterlot. Shares his design with S07E11 Unnamed Yak #4.

characters.name:
Yak Friendship Student
S09E26 Unnamed Yak #4
characters.description: Appears in The Last Problem in future Ponyville. She is a character named "Yak Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game bio states "The School of Friendship's future student body consists of creatures of all kinds -- including some of Yakyakistan's finest."
